programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of three. An anonymous caller alerts Phil Hunter to common threads in recent murders, and the team starts looking for a serial killer on the Sun Hill gay scene. Lance Powell struggles to come to terms with Mark's decision to take time out from their relationship and decides to drown his sorrows, but a visit to the gay bar he recently investigated puts him in grave danger(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of three. The shocked Sun Hill relief pull out all the stops to find the killer of popular colleague Lance Powell. As a tearful Laura Bryant is sent home on compassionate leave, a witness provides a breakthrough, and the trail of evidence leads back to Michael Keenan, the barman at gay club Radar. Amid the emotional turmoil, Phil Hunter accompanies Kate as she registers the birth of their son, and is devastated to learn she's leaving to live with her mother in Cardiff(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part three of three. Suspected gay serial killers John Lord and Michael Keenan are brought in for questioning. In spite of the stack of circumstantial evidence against them, a confession looks a long way off as the detectives get deeply embroiled in a battle of wits. Phil Hunter is stunned when wife Cindy breaks down in his arms with news about her IVF treatment(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The Sun Hill relief bid a final farewell to murdered colleague Lance Powell and Adam Okaro's funeral address is all the more moving for a spell on the beat alongside Laura Bryant. Nadir and Sim investigate a well known footballer accused of rape and discover he has form - as does the witness who gave his name to the police. A routine drugs bust turns into a free-for-all when the dealer's henchmen turn up in numbers at the critical moment(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: New boy PC Will Fletcher (Gary Lucy) gets off to a bad start at Sun Hill as he's stopped for speeding on the way, reprimanded for being late and put in his place for an inappropriate remark about a member of the public. He starts to feel more at home after a successful operation and a wind-up by Smithy and Tony Stamp. Things start to turn sour for Terry Perkins when he visits his brother in prison(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot(n)

programme.title: BalletShoes
programme.desc: (2007, General Movie/Drama) Emma Watson made her TV debut in this feature-length adaptation of Noel Streatfeild's classic novel. Set in London during the 1930s, it tells the story of orphans Pauline, Petrova and Posy Fossil, who are adopted by eccentric explorer Gum - although it is his selfless niece Sylvia who does most of the hard work involved in raising them. The girls face further upheaval when their guardian disappears, and the cash-strapped Sylvia is forced to take in lodgers, but despite their impoverished circumstances, the sisters still have grand plans. programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Claire and Simon seek eviction specialist Chris's help to evict a man claiming to be renting their old family home. Meanwhile, Hamza hopes to get his council flat back after he tried to help a neighbour's friend by letting them stay for a week, but ended up being shut out when they refused to leave. Plus, a man is almost £30k in debt and in danger of repossession after his tenants stopped paying the rent(n)

programme.title: Rich House, Poor House
programme.desc: Families from opposite ends of the wealth and class divide swap homes, budgets and social status for seven days to discover how the other half lives. In Lincolnshire, the Bentleys trade places with the Carter-Begbie family. The Bentleys rank in the top 10 per cent of Britain's wealthy, and live in a large four-bedroom house with three bathrooms, two reception rooms, a top-of-the-range kitchen, conservatory and games room. The Carter-Begbies live in a rented three-bedroom house and have a weekly budget of £140. This week, however, that will rise to almost £1,800(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away!

Meanwhile, agents Max and Paul are in Surrey as they attempt to collect more than £3,000 owed to a garage after a customer disputed the repairs made to his van(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away!

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away!

programme.desc: A collection of major TV howlers, including a fire on the Blue Peter set, famous folk who think they can sing, wardrobe malfunctions and disastrous award shows. There's a lowlight from The National Lottery Jetset as the studio is invaded, Lorraine Kelly being forced off the air, and a wannabe magician impaling the hand of a presenter. Bucks Fizz singer Cheryl Baker has insight into Eurovision's most off-key moments, while John Stapleton recalls The Time, The Place being ambushed. Other contributors include Sarah Cawood, Penny Smith, Dom Joly, Maria McErlane and Matt Johnson(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

However, Sheldon uses many attempts, but can't come up with a great scheme to pull back on Kripke, until a science experiment comes to his mind (which involves dropping lots and lots of foam from the ceiling right down on Kripke while recording the video to YouTube). Meanwhile, Howard is unsure if he wants to continue his relationship with Bernadette when he finds out she wants a commitment while he just wants sex(n)

programme.title: Super 8
programme.desc: Writer-director-producer JJ Abrams followed his Star Trek reboot with this blend of sci-fi thriller and emotionally engaging first-romance story, starring Joel Courtney and Elle Fanning. It's 1979 and 12-year-old Joe and his 8mm-movie-camera-owning friend Charles are secretly making a zombie flick for their local film festival. They've roped 14-year-old Alice into their project and she proves to be both an excellent actor and a romantic focus for the two boys. However, one night when the young moviemakers have snuck out to film a key scene, they witness - and record - a spectacular train crash. But there's more to the incident than meets the eye, as is demonstrated by the sudden appearance of the military on the scene, and the number of strange events that take place in the event's aftermath. And, as they investigate, the children begin to piece together the terrifying truth about what has happened... Co-produced by Steven Spielberg. Edited for language and violence(n)

programme.title: Prometheus
programme.desc: Noomi Rapace, Michael Fassbender, Charlize Theron and Idris Elba star in Ridley Scott's prequel to his seminal sci-fi horror Alien. In 2089, archaeologists Elizabeth Shaw and Charlie Holloway make a discovery on the Scottish island of Skye that suggests an extraterrestrial source for life on Earth. A decade later, those archaeologists are among the crew of the spaceship Prometheus, financed by the Weyland Corporation to explore unknown planets. Shortly after touching down on a remote world, Shaw and Holloway's Skye hypothesis appears to be confirmed by hard evidence. But excitement and jubilation quickly dissipate, as the hidden reason for their mission - and the great danger they are now in - begins to surface. With Fassbender as the crew's android; Theron as the Weyland official in charge of the operation; and Elba as captain of the Prometheus(n)

Jay designs a cover for Jake, who's managed to upset both his girlfriend and his mother with his ill-advised ink. Brave Amy calls on Alice to help her regain her body confidence after having a mastectomy. Harley also needs the fixers' help before he wears a kilt at his wedding and shows off the 'surprise' tattoo that he'd asked for as an apprentice. programme.desc: Leonard is depressed when he discovers that Penny is dating someone. As a result, and encouraged by his friends and fellow scientists, Leonard actually summons up the courage to ask a woman out on a date(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: After being fired from his job, Sheldon attempts to explore the 'dreadful' life beyond physics. But his initial thrill of shopping with Penny evolves over time to him weaving ponchos, forcing Leonard to call on Sheldon's mother, Mary(n)

programme.title: Krypton
programme.desc: Continuing the sci-fi drama following Seg-El, Superman's grandfather, who is faced with a life-and-death conflict. As the last son of House El, he vows to direct all his energy towards saving Krypton from Brainiac(n)

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.desc: The post-apocalyptic US horror drama and companion series to The Walking Dead continues. After they escape from a riot, Travis, Liza and Chris seek refuge with the Salazar family. Meanwhile, Madison defends her home(n)

programme.title: Rude Tube
programme.desc: Rude Tube celebrates the greatest internet videos ever, featuring the online 'heroes' who sing badly, dance terribly, and rant to webcams worldwide. Presented by Matt Kirshen, it contains the most impressive, outrageous and astounding internet clips and finds the gifted individuals responsible for them. This episode features a spectacular mix of hard-earned talents and unique abilities, from snake eaters to speed climbers, escalator skiers and incredible contortionists. Every clip has a story, and Rude Tube has tracked down and interviewed the remarkable characters behind the footage: a British 'fluteboxer', a Norwegian video editor with millions of fans, a drive-through rapper, and a tongue-sewing artiste(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Simone arrives at Price Slice to find it has been broken into and trashed, and Jesse complains that Courtney is taking him for granted. Glenn and Jesse share a heart-warming moment, and Brooke suffers a sensory overload at Imran's house. Plus, will Misbah tell her doctor about the abuse she's been subjected to?(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Brooke is at Imran's house for lunch when she suffers a sensory overload from the smell of Imran's aftershave. Ste is on a mission to find Tony, who is still missing(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Romeo is still trying his best to impress Lily. Misbah nearly tells her doctor about the abuse she is suffering from Imran, but ends up covering for him again(n)

programme.title: 2 Broke Girls

programme.title: 2 Broke Girls
programme.desc: Sophie takes Max and Caroline shopping for their bridesmaids' dresses, but when the girls find out that the wedding is going to be featured in a newspaper, they enlist the diner gang's help to hide the ugliest outfits, hoping to avoid complete and utter public humiliation(n)

programme.title: Melissa and Joey
programme.desc: Joe takes an interest in Mel's personal trainer as soon as they encounter each other. Lennox has a crush on Beckett but does her best to stay just friends with him(n)

programme.title: Melissa and Joey
programme.desc: Mel asks Joe to act as translator when she has a meeting with a Japanese businessman, but once they all get together for dinner, things turn awkward. Lennox and her nemesis are forced to work on a school project together(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Against Bonnie's advice, Ben persuades Danny to sign a sponsorship deal with a new brand of Japanese energy drink, but things soon go haywire at the commercial's photo shoot. Riley takes an interest in volunteering and accepts a job helping out at the hospital(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Dr Shaw decides that Riley is the cause of Danny's inability to focus during ice hockey matches and bans her from his next game. Riley thinks things are moving too fast with Fitch and starts to avoid him. Tucker competes with Ben's latest fling Jenna for a promotion at work(n)

programme.title: Young and Hungry
programme.desc: Gabi and Sofia are excited to be working together, but when an opportunity for a promotion comes up, both girls decide to go for it and things turn awkward. programme.title: Young and Hungry
programme.desc: Elliot and Alan are excited to learn that they'll be caring for a foster daughter named Keisha, but they are surprised when their charge turns out to be a teenager rather than a toddler, and taken aback when she rapidly forms a bond with Gabi(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Abby confesses that she's the mysterious saboteur warning other women to stay away from Barney but she reconciles her differences with him when they both realise that they have a shared hatred of Ted. They go to the bar and flaunt their faux romance but when Barney goes overboard and proposes to Abby, she takes his offer seriously(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Ted is knocked over by a taxi after trying to break up with Stella. His friends tell Barney what has happened to Ted but before they can tell him that Ted is ok, he hangs up and dashes out to the hospital. Barney is knocked over by a bus going the wrong way and breaks all his bones in his body. Ted is touched by his friend's concern and he and Barney become friends again. Stella breaks up with Ted when she realises that he meant to break up with her before the accident. Ted rushes to see her at the zoo where she's taken her daughter and proposes to her with a toy dinosaur. Series three finale(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Barry enlists his friends to help him break up Beverly's social group in order to get more of his mother's attention, but when big arguments ensue he realises he's made a major error. Adam's attempts to trick Murray into loving the theatre backfire(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Hoping to enjoy a true spring break experience, Erica and Barry pay a visit to Pops in Florida, but the jaunt isn't what they expected. Adam tells the truth to his parents when he has a mishap with Beverly's new coat, but he gets a surprising reaction(n)

programme.title: Tooth Fairy
programme.desc: Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson stars in Michael Lembeck's family fantasy comedy about a tough-guy sportsman who learns the hard way not to puncture a child's illusions. Derek Thompson is an ice hockey pro whose main tactic is flattening opponents - often depriving them of a tooth or two in the process. His aggression has earned him the nickname 'Tooth Fairy', but when he unsportingly tells his girlfriend's daughter that tooth fairies don't exist, the very real fairies decide to teach him a lesson. He's whipped away to Fairy Land, where he's sentenced to a week's community service as a tooth fairy. He sprouts wings, receives an outfit completely at odds with his macho image and is given a mentor. As the comedic misunderstandings and slapstick errors mount, it's all too clear that Thompson isn't cut out for his new line of work(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Raj and Howard go on a camping trip that alters their minds. Back home, Penny dislocates her shoulder when she slips in the shower and Sheldon has to drive her to hospital(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon decides to use his great mind to come up with the perfect prank to pull on Kripke after he was humiliated on National Radio because Kripke had put helium in Sheldon's office (making his voice girly while on the radio). However, Sheldon uses many attempts, but can't come up with a great scheme to pull back on Kripke, until a science experiment comes to his mind (which involves dropping lots and lots of foam from the ceiling right down on Kripke while recording the video to YouTube). Meanwhile, Howard is unsure if he wants to continue his relationship with Bernadette when he finds out she wants a commitment while he just wants sex(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: Hollyoaks

The cake will be a life-size ball gown, complete with 50 edible peacock feathers and 3000 gold flowers(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.desc: Simon is about to sit his first driving test, and Will, Jay and Neil are very excited by the new possibilities that a car will bring. But disaster strikes when Simon rips off the car's door while parking. Will is determined not to let this ruin their trip and convinces him to at least go on the rides before leaving to get it fixed. However, all the perma-tanned chutzpah in the world can't prepare Lauren for Danny arriving with a little too much Dutch courage. Liver bird Emma, who's 33, is yet to meet a man who can handle her ways, and wants to bag 'a man's man'. On her menu is 39-year-old ex-Navy gunner Ian. programme.title: Baby Daddy

programme.desc: Josh is about to launch a new app and hires Randall, an efficient and industrious extra assistant, to help him with the rush. Thinking Randall is a little too good at his job, Gabi, Elliot and Yolanda set out to get him fired. Sofia is annoyed when her new neighbour constantly plays loud music(n)

programme.title: Young and Hungry
programme.desc: Gabi is thrilled when she wins a local cookery contest using a recipe from her Aunt Chris. When the organisers want to take a picture of Gabi and her aunt, Gabi must search for someone she hasn't seen in years. Josh relives his childhood bowling trauma, and Elliot regrets joining Yolanda's poker game(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Lily is worried about Marshall who is losing hope on finding his dream job and spending his days wandering around his flat in his underpants. After an intense diet, Robin suggests that the gang go to a burger bar. Once there, the friends all praise the burger but Marshall disagrees and tells them the story of the finest burger he's ever eaten. The gang set out to find the restaurant where Marshall ate his first New York burger(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly takes up dancing with her friends but is dejected when her family are unimpressed by her intention to perform a dance routine in a recital. Adam worries about losing his friendship with Emmy when she starts dating a handsome older classmate, but his attempts to be cooler than the newcomer backfire(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Barry gets the chance to throw the first pitch at a Phillies baseball game and believes this represents his opportunity to play professionally, but he couldn't be more wrong. Meanwhile, Erica makes an important decision about her future in college(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard has regrets about introducing Bernadette to the others when she and Leonard really start to get along; forcing him into an uncomfortable position in which he will do anything to separate them again. Meanwhile, Penny sees the connection between Bernadette and Howard and she wants to learn what Leonard's job really is about. However, her only choice for help is Sheldon, who isn't the best teacher for those not so interested in science(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard's mother, Beverly, returns for another visit. Leonard is still not pleased with her coming over, while Sheldon is ecstatic. Penny, however, stresses over the fact that Leonard hasn't told his mother that he is in a relationship with Penny, and she waits for the perfect moment to tell her, which seems to only be when Beverly becomes drunk for the first time. Meanwhile, Sheldon and Leonard are having friendship issues when it turns out Sheldon has been keeping frequent contact with Beverly while Leonard has been left out(n)

programme.title: Melissa and Joey
programme.desc: Mel's father returns to town to lobby for a political bill that Mel is strongly opposed to. When Lennox writes some poems, her verses catch the attention of a popular classmate who wants to become a singer(n)

Joe soon starts to get nervous that Tony and Mel are hitting it off so well. Lennox tries to avoid Ryder when he has a cold so she won't miss a big party at the weekend(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Ben finds out that his neighbour Kayla is hosting a playgroup for all of the kids in the area but is excluding Emma because she thinks Ben is a horrible dad, so he devises a plan to sneak Emma into the group. Danny goes to Riley for help when his relationship with Amy gets rocky(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Ben learns why Riley doesn't like celebrating her birthday and it's all his fault. He knows he needs to make it up to her and plans a perfect birthday surprise, but in typical Ben Wheeler fashion, disaster ensues. Bonnie reveals she forgot to complete some paperwork and that Ben isn't Emma's sole custodian(n)

programme.title: Young and Hungry
programme.desc: Josh's father Matt contacts his son for the first time, asking to meet. When Josh refuses, assuming his father is only after his money, Gabi takes matters into her own hands. Convinced that she'll die at the same age as her mother, Yolanda goes on a strict diet and fitness regime - but it seems it could be Elliot who's at risk(n)

programme.title: Young and Hungry
programme.desc: Josh tries to bond with his father Matt, but they have trouble finding common ground. When Matt decides to head out of town again, Gabi intervenes and brings Matt along to Josh's softball game in an effort to help them bond. Yolanda recruits Sofia to help sell Squirrel Ranger cookies so she can win a cruise(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Jake Peralta is a talented but carefree detective at Brooklyn's 99th Precinct. He and his eclectic group of colleagues are used to having a commanding officer who doesn't make them work too hard or follow the rules too closely. But when tightly-wound Captain Ray Holt, a man with a lot to prove, takes over, he is determined to make his dysfunctional team of detectives into the best precinct squad in Brooklyn(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: When Jake turns up late for morning roll call, Captain Holt responds by assigning him to a minor graffiti case and then closely monitoring his every move. But the investigation soon turns into a major headache when the vandal turns out to be the Deputy Police Commissioner's son. Gina's psychic friend Carlene pays a visit to the precinct to help the detectives with a drugs case, but she manages to upset Charles by making a prediction about his romantic life(n)

programme.desc: Sheldon has been awarded a prestigious prize by the university but is scared of collecting the gong at an awards ceremony because he knows he'll have to give a speech. Penny tries to gee him up with rousing references to X-Men(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: Gogglebox

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This time Four in a Bed becomes 'Four in a Camp Bed', as four sets of campsite proprietors battle to be named best value. The competition begins at Amber's Bell Tent Camping in north Norfolk, a retro-styled pre-erected campsite created by artistic host Amber Wykes. Amber challenges her guests to go native, with a series of bushcraft trials. Over dinner, guests Derek and Julie's opinions on glamping irritate both Amber, and glampsite owners Nick and Sheila. Then back at the tents, brother and sister team Russell and Jane aren't too impressed with the sleeping arrangements. In the morning the self-catering breakfast leads to complaints, which Amber hears all about when she reviews their feedback forms(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second day of the competition is at Park Farm Camping and Caravan Site in Norfolk, where husband and wife team Derek and Julie Nice are proud to show off their budget, family-friendly site. Former marksman Derek treats his guests to a spot of clay pigeon shooting, bringing out his competitive side. But when inexperienced shooter Amber proves to be a natural, Derek's nose is put out of joint(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to 500-year-old Layer Marney Tower in Essex, where posh hosts Nick and Sheila Charrington warmly welcome the guests into their luxury glamping lodges. There's a treasure hunt that sends one of the teams off on a wild goose chase. Their campers find few faults with the accommodation, but over dinner Amber shares a revelation that changes the way the guests see things(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth day of the competition is at the Foxhunter Park in Kent, where gregarious brother-and-sister team Jane Stacey and Russell Saunders own a luxury caravanning site that includes a bistro and entertainment. The accommodation is luxurious but the large scale of the site and holiday camp feel doesn't sit well with any of the campers(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: On the final day of the competition, the campers meet one last time to find out what they thought each other's stay was worth(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Dundee, the first competitor to cook is alarm company owner Bill Black, who plans a belt-busting menu for his guests, proud Arbroathian Phil Petrie, opinionated English student Hannah Wilson, ferret-fancier Alex Pithouse, and 28-year-old Kim Gillespie(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Architectural technician Alex Pithouse is second to host in Dundee and plans on giving his guests an education in fine dining with a complex menu and some fine wines. He also looks forward to introducing his guests to the 'fur babies' - his three pet ferrets(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cat-loving vegetarian Hannah Wilson cooks Italian in Dundee and has a cunning plan to win over her carnivore guests: dish up some meat with her starter(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fourth to cook in Dundee is self-styled food critic Phil Petrie, who has been less than impressed with the standard of food he's been offered so far. Phil has big plans for his own night. But unfortunately he runs out of ingredients and leaves his guests feeling hungry(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night in Dundee, Kim Gillespie plans a 'Yorkshire-themed' menu featuring dishes from Spain and Thailand, accompanied by a Scottish choir singing American songs!(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer's Stately Homes
programme.desc: New and first on More4: When is a stately home not a stately home? When it's a stately castle. At beautiful Belvoir Castle in Leicestershire, Phil is invited by the Duke and Duchess of Rutland to learn how the castle was built - and discovers a Regency love story to rival any of Jane Austen's. The present-day Duchess Emma introduces Phil to her Regency predecessor, Duchess Elizabeth, and allows Phil exclusive access to the Belvoir's usually off-limits archive. Phil learns that the castle's creators had to sell whole villages to fund the building work, and reveals the mind-boggling total cost in today's money. Phil encounters evidence of an aristocratic sex scandal painted on the ceiling, which was later disguised by royal decree. He searches for a lost railway under the castle, and tries his hand at modern-day pest control with a medieval twist(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.desc: New and first on More4: In the Dales, young William Dawson is in sole charge of lambing for the first time, with 800 new lambs delivered over a frenetic month. James Ratcliffe returns to Sedbergh with his new family after 19 years away, with plans to transform a pub into a top-end restaurant. Also returning to Yorkshire after years away is Squadron Leader Neil Taylor, who's helping a colleague hone his navigational skills in Wensleydale. In The Lakes, castle owners Iona and Peter Frost-Pennington are preparing for one of their biggest events of the year, the international jester tournament(n)

programme.title: Sarah Millican: Chatterbox Live
programme.desc: Chatterbox Live invites viewers to enter the wonderful world of Sarah Millican. Recorded at the Bloomsbury Theatre in London, Millican discusses, in her trademark warm and convivial style, how living alone drives your parents to put you on suicide watch and how a bath-time cup of tea is the epitome of luxury. The comedian also offers advice for life including a non-fattening form of stress relief, the alternative to marriage, and the acceptable face of adultery(n)

programme.title: Ricky Gervais Live: Animals
programme.desc: A record of multiple Golden Globe-winner Ricky Gervais's first-ever stand-up tour, Animals. It features his performance at the Bloomsbury Theatre, and also backstage footage of Ricky's private life, sharing some of the preparations and frustrations involved in writing and performing a sell-out West End run(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel game show, as Sean Lock and Mel Giedroyc take on guest captain Lee Mack and David O'Doherty. Adam Buxton joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the panel game, with Sean Lock and Freddie Flintoff taking on guest captain Bill Bailey and Roisin Conaty. Rob Beckett joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay has just one week to turn round the D-Place in Chelmsford, Essex, run by Mexican-born Israel and his English partner Tara. They've sunk £150,000 of their own money into their trendy café bar, which offers a vast selection of fusion cuisine. In charge is executive chef Philippe, producing everything from all-day breakfasts to hoi sin noodles... with an astounding lack of flair; the plastic food is dire and boomerangs back from the dining room as soon as it's cooked. The restaurant manager, spunky Essex boy Dave, loathes his chef, and their mutual hatred spills over into permanent running battles. Faced with dysfunctional staff and a disastrous menu, Gordon is about to endure the longest week of his professional life(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel game show, as Sean Lock and Mel Giedroyc take on guest captain Lee Mack and David O'Doherty. Adam Buxton joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer take on one of the toughest property markets going: south-west London. Kirstie's with Jason and Jaye, who're searching for a one-bed pad in Clapham or Brixton. Phil's with Hannah and Frank, who want a family home before they can get hitched and start a family(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are in Cardiff - one of the more expensive places to buy property in Wales. Kirstie's with Jo and Steve, who are moving from Bristol to cut Jo's commute to work. Phil's with Shauna and Todd, who admit their pricey taste in property is making it tough to find a family home(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer conduct a vast search across three counties: Hampshire, Wiltshire and Surrey. Kirstie is with retirees Sheila and Jason, who have been living out of boxes for a year after they sold their home in Morecambe to be nearer to their families in the south. Meanwhile, Phil's with Sue and Alan, who've been living in Sue's sister's one-bed house for nine months after moving back from Australia. Unfortunately, even their budget of £450,000 doesn't stretch to the spacious apartment they had down under, and getting them to downsize to a property back in Blighty could be an uphill struggle for Phil(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: First to host in Peterborough is salesman and wannabe rapper Warren Temple, who believes his Spanish menu is good enough to win him the prize. His guests are ethical trader Donna Trafford, glamour model Susie Hutson, straight-talking businesswoman Vicki Culverhouse and veterinary nurse Robin Hills(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hippy entrepreneur Donna Trafford is second to host in Peterborough and plans a colourful evening of delicious food and relaxed fun(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On night three in Peterborough, glamour model and columinst Susie Hutson is out to prove she's not the dizzy blonde some of the guests assume she is. And indeed it doesn't take long for ethical trader Donna Trafford and wannabe rapper Warren Temple to make an unexpected discovery which proves there's more to Susie than meets the eye(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's the turn of straight-talking businesswoman Vicki Culverhouse to host in Peterborough. Having been very direct with the other diners, Vicki surprises the group when she unleashes some poetry at the table(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Veterinary nurse Robin Hills is the final host in this competition in Peterborough and hopes his animal-themed night will be a big hit with his guests, as well as his well-presented cuisine(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This competition starts at Swallows Rest in Weymouth, Dorset, where hosts Jane and Keith Smith are pulling out all the stops to win. All of Jane and Keith's rooms have been decorated by the lady of the house, but some of the colour combinations don't go down well with rival B&B owner Ray Chowdhury(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to The Burley Inn in the New Forest, where newly-weds Darren and James welcome the guests. Donna and David prove to have a critical eye when they discover some holes in the sheets, and Jane and Keith disagree over a toilet roll. In the afternoon, hosts Darren and James reveal their quizmaster skills and, over dinner, Ray gives them a good grilling on how they run their B&B(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to Hotel Montville in Redditch, Worcestershire, where host Ray Chowdhury hopes to win over his rival B&B owners. Ray's unique style and decor impresses at first, but room inspections leave guests Jane and Keith Smith threatening not to stay. Light relief comes in the form of ice sculpting(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to The Silverton in Shrewsbury, where business partners Donna and David have split B&B responsibilities down the middle. In the afternoon, the hosts whip up the competitive spirit as they challenge their guests to a race on Segways. Over dinner, Donna gets emotional after the guests question her work-life balance(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: It's the final day in the competition and the owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. Accusations fly around the table as payments are revealed and the winner is announced(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Yeovil, 28-year-old PR manager Emmy Webster hopes to impress her guests with locally sourced produce and a main course of Somerset pork. Emmy's guests are self-proclaimed country bumpkin Mel Dunford, second-hand car salesman Andy Neil, radio broadcaster Steve Carpenter and businessman Alan Bunter. Emmy has a disaster with the hollandaise sauce for her starter and tries to hide the fact that she's used a shop-bought concoction. But she's inevitably rumbled(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Disc jockey Steve Carpenter hosts in Yeovil. A bon viveur, raconteur and quick wit, Steve hopes that sourcing the finest ingredients for his 'country-style' cooking will secure him the £1000 prize. But as the pressure takes its toll, Steve allows an unwanted ingredient onto one of his guests' plates and then reveals that he's been divorced three times(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: With an exotic menu, including her own invention - duck vindaloo - diminutive fork-lift driver Mel Dunford hopes to prove her doubters wrong in Yeovil. And it's not just her culinary skills that surprise her guests; she also breaks into song, leaving everyone gobsmacked(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Yeovil, muscleman Alan Bunter hopes that his enthusiasm for all things Japanese will brush off on his guests. But car salesman Andy and DJ Steve don't feel the Zen spirit and spend the evening at each other's throats, while Emmy and Mel struggle to get a word in. And with rotten beans, tofu cheesecake and soggy noodles on the menu it looks like Alan may have created a recipe for disaster(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the last night in Yeovil, 50-year-old used-car dealer Andy Neil is supremely confident that his fine-dining experience and 'amazing home' will bag him the £1000 prize. A selection of six amuse-bouches for his starter are a visual and culinary treat, but will his need for feedback and praise put his guests off? Andy also has to contend with local radio personality Steve jockeying for position as top dog, and fussy eater Mel, who isn't afraid to tell Andy exactly what she thinks of his fancy food(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of 5 Year Olds
programme.desc: The Bafta award-nominated series that lifts the lid on the uncensored drama of life in the playground continues. In last week's episode the girls and boys were kept apart, but now it's party time. Five of the girls and five of the boys return to the play centre, but how do they react when they find out that they have to share it with the opposite sex? And will our experiment bear out research that suggests that, at five years old, girls and boys often positively benefit from mixed gender groups? Last week, Jude, Oscar and the boys displayed some pretty well formed gender stereotypes. Now they're horrified to discover that there's a cross-dressing task and they must dress up as girls. Why don't the girls share their horror? And we found out that girls show signs of empathy from as young as three to four months and have better language and communication skills at five years old than boys do. But boys are generally less risk-averse and outperform girls at spatial awareness tasks(n)

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: The series that follows some of Britain's busiest air ambulance teams as they race to bring the hospital emergency department to the roadside. In this first episode, two motorcyclists need specialist care, as the helicopter medics try to save the life of Pete, while Tom may have a serious spinal injury. And a woman is kicked in the face by her horse(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency?
programme.desc: 999: What's Your Emergency examines the challenging work of the police, paramedics and fire service in Wiltshire. Over 60,000 people in Wiltshire have mental health issues but with mental health support services across the UK being cut it's falling to the emergency services to pick up the pieces. With calls to 999 now at record levels, Wiltshire Police and South West Ambulance call handlers regularly find themselves counselling people with severe mental health episodes rather than dealing with emergencies. Wiltshire Police call handler Amanda Southey and her colleagues are bombarded with 999 calls every three seconds from a man claiming he is the archangel Michael. Despite their attempts to help, eventually all they can do is send an officer to arrest him to keep the lines free for life and death emergencies(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A and E
programme.desc: This episode focuses on men with very different problems who are all being treated at King's College Hospital's Emergency Department on a busy night shift. Stacey, a 37-year-old dad of six, and grandfather, has come to King's with his girlfriend Tara. He's suffering from breathing difficulties. He had a collapsed lung eight years ago and is afraid the symptoms have returned. Stacey demands a bed and a sandwich as well as immediate attention from senior staff nurse Laura, who's in charge of the busy Minors section. But it becomes clear that his attitude masks vulnerability about being in hospital. Twenty-six-year-old Andrew trains at the gym every day with a group of friends who call themselves 'The Spartans', but he arrives at King's with back pain after being knocked off his motorbike by a car. Sam has been rushed to resus after being kicked and punched in the head and body outside one of London's most exclusive nightclubs(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Gordon visits Momma Cherri's Soul Food Shack, an intimate 40-seater a stone's throw from Brighton's seafront. Owner Charita Jones produces a menu of irresistibly unique classics from the Deep South. The food's hard to fault, but the punters are nowhere to be seen. Head chef Brian and a rag-tag collection of part-timers are taking the mickey and, despite working a seven-day week, Charita's got an empty restaurant and a £65,000 debt. If ever there was a case of too many cooks, this is it. Charita's a natural, but she's never made a profit on the restaurant and is now facing financial disaster. Can Gordon successfully shut her out of the kitchen, get the chef back on the boil and put the soul back into the business, or will the shack shut up shop for good?(n)

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: The series that follows some of Britain's busiest air ambulance teams as they race to bring the hospital emergency department to the roadside. In this first episode, two motorcyclists need specialist care, as the helicopter medics try to save the life of Pete, while Tom may have a serious spinal injury. And a woman is kicked in the face by her horse(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency?
programme.desc: 999: What's Your Emergency examines the challenging work of the police, paramedics and fire service in Wiltshire. Over 60,000 people in Wiltshire have mental health issues but with mental health support services across the UK being cut it's falling to the emergency services to pick up the pieces. With calls to 999 now at record levels, Wiltshire Police and South West Ambulance call handlers regularly find themselves counselling people with severe mental health episodes rather than dealing with emergencies. Wiltshire Police call handler Amanda Southey and her colleagues are bombarded with 999 calls every three seconds from a man claiming he is the archangel Michael. Despite their attempts to help, eventually all they can do is send an officer to arrest him to keep the lines free for life and death emergencies(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Host Jimmy Carr and team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson play the topical comedy panel show that delves into the world of polls, surveys and statistics. Jimmy oversees the disputes and deliberations on the current events that set the nation's chins wagging, with celebrity guests Sarah Millican, Micky Flanagan, Georgie Thompson and Louie Spence(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty, Kate Quilton and Matt Tebbutt uncover more unusual, intriguing and surprising secrets behind the food we eat. Kate investigates alternative milks. At one of California's leading producers of almond milk, she finds out how many almonds make it into each bottle; before meeting a scientist who's been raising genetically engineered goats, whose milk he hopes might one day save half a million lives every year. Jimmy investigates reports that some of the fish we buy may not be what we think it is. At a remarkable bunker in Oxfordshire, he joins a team of agents who monitor every vessel in the world's oceans and detect any signs of suspicious behaviour. Then Jimmy hooks up with a fish detective in Edinburgh, on a covert mission buying and testing fish to make sure it's the real deal. And what exactly is spreadable butter? Is it butter or margarine? An extraordinary award-winning butter sculptor helps Matt find out(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Wendy Tyler has long dreamed of living in Spain and recently found a job in Benidorm. Danni Menzies shows Wendy and her best friend Diana five properties for her budget of £70,000(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lea and Tony Desborough from Essex have fallen in love with Menorca on countless holidays over the last 20 years, and dream of owning their own place there. Now, as they wind down their work commitments, they've decided it's time to make that dream a reality. Laura Hamilton shows them five coastal villas for their £250,000 budget(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Trecarne House in Liskeard, Cornwall, where owners Trish and Tom Brock-Morgan hope to be crowned best value B&B of the week. Dominic is impressed with his room with a view and Rayne and Chris can't conceal their enthusiasm as they tuck into the complimentary treats, but Stephen and Joanna's dust-hunt yields results(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Windsor, where Captain Dominic Read runs the Magna Carta, a five-star floating B&B. Stephen and Joanna are bowled over by the former working barge, and Rayne and Chris are impressed with the girth of their berth. However, Trish and Tom struggle to detect that five-star feel in their cabin(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to Ash Cottage in Leeds, Kent, where Rayne and Chris Deal hope to be crowned best B&B of the week. The unique decor is an eye-opener for the guests, but it isn't everyone's cup of tea and Trish and Tom get heated over the instant coffee(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to A Room with a View in Brighton where owner Stephen Bull and housekeeper Joanna Harris hope their nine-room establishment can deliver a top-notch experience(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The proud B&B owners come together for one last time to confront their critics face-to-face and to find out who's won(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: First to host in Oxford is ladies' man Marlon Williams, whose Love Island-themed evening gets off to a shambolic start, and ends with smashing plates. His guests are party girl Heidi Kelloway, inventor Richard Berrecloth, housewife Victoria Collett and doggie day-care owner James Hearle(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Inventor Richard Berrecloth serves up an entirely home-made extravaganza, including the mysterious 'Tournados Rossini' and unique entertainment. But food seems to be the last thing on flirtatious Heidi and Marlon's minds. And the wine flows a little too freely for 28-year-old former assistant funeral director Victoria Collett(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mum-of-three Victoria Collett starts day three in Oxford with a bad hangover and a few culinary disasters. It's not long before her guests are grumbling and Richard starts criticising her cooking, calling her seafood starter just 'edible'. Dinner party perfectionist Victoria hopes her Caribbean curry will save the day, but it leaves a bitter taste(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The knives are out on day four in Oxford as doggy day-care owner James Hearle attempts to fib his way through an interrogation of his cooking abilities. Tempers rise between brutally honest culinary critic Richard Berrecloth and the rest of the guests. Meanwhile, James's four-legged friends threaten to turn the evening into a complete dog's dinner(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's the final day of the competition in Oxford, and party girl Heidi Kelloway is determined to lighten the mood and host the best dinner party of the week. But things turn sour at the table when the other guests angrily confront tactical, critical Richard Berrecloth(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Phil and Caroline Mansell from Wales have been holidaying together in the La Marina Alta region of Spain's Costa Blanca for years. Phil, who suffers from severe arthritis, finds the climate helps his symptoms so they're selling their home back in the UK and are planning a full-time move. Ben Hillman shows them five properties for their £100,000 budget but will any of them be their dream home?(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: There's a tragedy in Chester Zoo's elephant house. The Hi Way elephant family have been hit with a potentially deadly virus that affects animals in captivity and in the wild. With the youngest members of the family most at risk, the keepers and the zoo's veterinary team do all they can to combat the mysterious illness. Mac the stallion zebra is introduced to the zoo's three mares in the hope that they will produce much-needed offspring for this endangered species. But the reaction from the mares isn't quite what the keepers had hoped for and Mac must try to earn his stripes among the herd. There's also a fascinating look into the bizarre world of the naked mole rat. Matriarch Janet rules her empire with an iron paw. She's the head of a 38-strong colony of worker rats and is expecting her next litter(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A three-year-old Newfoundland needs surgery for his bent front legs. Caroline is paralysed in her arms and legs and requires 24-hour care; her German shepherd has a painful degenerative spinal disease that needs fixing. And a long-haired chihuahua requires a total hip replacement(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Helen Gould and Phil Reddy wanted their Cumbrian home to make the most of the spectacular views, but they also wanted it to be ecologically friendly. Their solution was to build an earth-sheltered home, with most of the house built into the hillside. They used large quantities of concrete and waterproof membranes to protect themselves against leaking, and sank lightwells into the back of the building to provide them with a modicum of light. But would this building survive the climate, and would the technologies deliver the ecological lifestyle Helen and Phil wanted so much? Kevin McCloud returns to find out(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer's Stately Homes
programme.desc: and first on More4: Phil visits the beautiful Houghton Hall in Norfolk, built by Britain's first Prime Minister, the wily Sir Robert Walpole. Phil is keener than ever to uncover the building costs, because they were Sir Robert's best kept secret. As guest of its current owner, Lord David Cholmondeley, Phil uncovers a house clearly built without any limit on costs: It features some of the finest carved stone interiors ever created, jaw-dropping bedrooms, 'beer taps' in a marble dining room, and the most extravagant thing Phil has ever seen: a 17ft silver embroidered bed. It's no wonder Sir Robert wanted to keep the costs - and how he raised the money - a secret; the truth could have rocked Parliament(n)

programme.title: A Very British Hotel
programme.desc: In the final episode of the series that goes behind the scenes at London's exclusive Mandarin Oriental Hyde Park hotel, the hotel throws a party to celebrate the book launch of Mount: the latest novel by the famous racy romance writer Jilly Cooper. Champagne, canapés and a grey stallion are laid on for the entertainment of the guests, but not everyone is welcome, as a gatecrasher is escorted off the premises. The hotel also reveals its secret weapon: Hotel Ambassador Mr Bentley. Mr B worked for the Savoy, Claridge's and the Ritz before joining the team at the Mandarin Oriental Hyde Park. He was responsible for the Queen hosting a special banquet in the ballroom the night before the wedding of Prince William and Kate(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A and E
programme.desc: The RTS award-winning 24 Hours in A&E returns, capturing dramatic and emotional stories of love, life and loss on the frontline of the NHS. Filmed around the clock at one of Britain's busiest A&E departments at King's College Hospital in south London, the series begins with a powerful episode about how our lives can change forever in the blink of an eye. In a shocking random act of violence, a young woman is knocked to the ground after being punched in the face by a stranger on her way home from work. Lying in the street, she's fighting for her life when Andrew, a passer-by, finds her and calls 999. A&E doctor Des has worked at King's for over five years and is rarely shocked by what he sees, but when the unidentified young woman arrives in Resus with life-threatening swelling on her brain, the impact is felt by him and the entire department(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A and E
programme.desc: This RTS award-winning series, filmed around the clock at one of Britain's busiest A&E departments at King's College Hospital in south London, continues with a moving and tender episode about three daughters' love for their mother. Eighty-year-old Rose has fluid on her lungs and is having trouble breathing. Her three daughters Christine, Sandra and Debbie put on brave faces around their mother's bedside, convincing her that everything will be all right, but in the relatives' room there is high emotion as they tearfully contemplate life without her. Also in Resus is Kevin, a 55-year-old trucker who jack-knifed his lorry, 'bullseyed' the windscreen and rolled down a verge. He has injuries to his pelvis, neck and head - his wife Janet waits anxiously to find out how serious it is(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer's Stately Homes
programme.desc: and first on More4: Phil visits the beautiful Houghton Hall in Norfolk, built by Britain's first Prime Minister, the wily Sir Robert Walpole. Phil is keener than ever to uncover the building costs, because they were Sir Robert's best kept secret. As guest of its current owner, Lord David Cholmondeley, Phil uncovers a house clearly built without any limit on costs: It features some of the finest carved stone interiors ever created, jaw-dropping bedrooms, 'beer taps' in a marble dining room, and the most extravagant thing Phil has ever seen: a 17ft silver embroidered bed. It's no wonder Sir Robert wanted to keep the costs - and how he raised the money - a secret; the truth could have rocked Parliament(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A and E
programme.desc: The RTS award-winning 24 Hours in A&E returns, capturing dramatic and emotional stories of love, life and loss on the frontline of the NHS. Filmed around the clock at one of Britain's busiest A&E departments at King's College Hospital in south London, the series begins with a powerful episode about how our lives can change forever in the blink of an eye. In a shocking random act of violence, a young woman is knocked to the ground after being punched in the face by a stranger on her way home from work. Lying in the street, she's fighting for her life when Andrew, a passer-by, finds her and calls 999. A&E doctor Des has worked at King's for over five years and is rarely shocked by what he sees, but when the unidentified young woman arrives in Resus with life-threatening swelling on her brain, the impact is felt by him and the entire department(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: An extended edition of the comedy panel show that delves into the world of polls, surveys and statistics, with host Jimmy Carr and team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson. This edition's guests are Joe Wilkinson, Ellie Taylor, Natalie Cassidy and Gabby Logan(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty, Kate Quilton and Matt Tebbutt continue travelling the globe in their quest to uncover more unusual, intriguing and surprising secrets behind the food we eat. Jimmy is in Scotland to get behind the headlines of a mysterious condition threatening our salmon farms. Can high-tech surveillance and an innovative natural solution save our salmon and halt the dramatic price hikes? Kate heads down under to find out about a surprising new meat bouncing into our supermarkets, but how on earth do you farm a kangaroo? They may be a much-loved Aussie icon, but Kate finds out that kangaroos outnumber the human population 2:1, so adding them to the BBQ menu could be the most sustainable option to control the numbers. And Matt's finding out the secrets behind the annual race to get new season asparagus onto our supermarket shelves(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Creative Brighton couple Emily and Peter Harold have been holidaying on the Spanish island of Mallorca for 14 years, and are determined to buy a second home there. They're looking for somewhere to relax and soak up the sun and culture on offer in their favourite spot of Port de Sóller. Laura Hamilton shows them five apartments for their £250,000 budget(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Denise Greenacre has retired and is determined to buy a home in Spain. Ben Hillman shows Denise and her daughter Rebecca five properties around Torrevieja on the Costa Blanca for her £80,000 budget. Are any of them the place she's been longing for?(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Nateby Inn in Cumbria, where landlady Gaynor Walker is ready with a warm welcome. A trip to Gaynor's local brewery turns out to be a barrel of laughs when Andrew Ashmore beats Bob Osborne in a cask-rolling competition. However, at dinner, Bob reclaims pole position in the conversation stakes when he reveals he once lived in a cave(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Ravensden, Bedfordshire, where owners Graham and Julia Ashley run Outfields Farm Bed and Breakfast. The hosts treat their guests to an adrenaline-fuelled afternoon at an indoor skydiving centre, before whisking them back to the B&B for a dinner full of surprises(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to At Home in Chiswick, west London, where artist Bob Osborne takes a laid-back approach to running his B&B. On arrival, guests are pleasantly surprised by their first impression of Bob's communal living space-cum-mini art gallery, but on closer inspection, the guests are soon dishing the dirt(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to Chard, Somerset, where Andrew and Clare Ashmore own the Ammonite Lodge guest house. The competitive B&Bers have gone head-to-head in a whole host of activities this week and today Andrew and Clare hope to bowl their guests over with a game of skittles(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: It's time for the B&Bers to face the music, as they come together for one last time to find out what they've been paid and confront their critics, face-to-face(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hosting first in Glasgow is make-up artist Craig Alexander Wilson, who is throwing a glitz-and-glamour party, complete with edible glitter and sparklers. Craig's guests are trainee dance teacher Mandy Wong, practical joker Paul Cowan, fun-loving Caroline Wardrope and opinionated music teacher Siobhan Daly. But Craig's attempt to guess his guests' ages doesn't go down very well(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Paul Cowan serves his guests Balmoral steak with whisky sauce on day two in Glasgow, as well as his mysteriously-titled 'Paul's Cream Puff'. But is cheeky Paul more interested in dishing out practical jokes than food?(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dance fanatic Mandy Wong hosts a Latin dance fever evening with an Asian-inspired menu. But the night doesn't end so well as bubbly Caroline has to run to the bathroom during Mandy's dance routine, and Mandy serves up a disastrous dessert(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Music teacher and professional flautist Siobhan Daly plans to beat the boys with a rock and pop icons evening. The self-professed queen of cooking serves up cod and chorizo stew and shows off her piano skills for dessert(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final day of the competition in Glasgow, bubbly blonde Caroline Wardrope hosts a 1970s-themed disco diva party with a mystery menu. The food seems to go down well, but there are some shocking revelations, as the guests finally find out about Caroline's profession(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Elaine and Nicos Nicolaou fell in love with each other and then, four years later, fell in love with Kefalonia. They want to get back to their Greek roots by buying a property there. For their budget of £60,000, Jasmine Harman shows them five properties in the beautiful south of the island. Will any of them be the place of their dreams?(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Four fledgling Humboldt penguins are being brought up apart from the main colony until they're old enough to compete for fish in the main pool. But they're keen to make a break for it and join the adults. Niall the chimp keeper has known chimp Boris for 44 years and has developed a special relationship with him. When Boris captures a moorhen chick Niall must use all his powers of persuasion to negotiate the safe release of his hostage. Meanwhile, the team hope to kindle a spark between Bornean river turtles Raja and Aris by bringing them together in a new enclosure(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Ken has travelled through the night to bring his much-loved Dobermann down from Cumbria to see Professor Noel Fitzpatrick about a diseased spinal cord. A cocker spaniel is rushed in after being hit by a car. And a rabbit with a broken ankle needs surgery(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: The first time Kevin McCloud met Kelly and Masoko Neville, they had set about building an oak-framed, straw-baled hexagonal house in the Cambridgeshire Fens. Kelly had always dreamed of building an eco-friendly home but the unusual hexagonal design would have challenged the most experienced builder, and with no architect to turn to for advice, Kelly had to tackle all the problems alone. Kevin goes back to see if they are managing to lead the idyllic life they so craved(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency?
programme.desc: 999: What's Your Emergency? focuses on the relentless work of Wiltshire's police, paramedic and fire services. Every year 10,000 new drivers pass their tests and gain access to the county's roads. For many young men, a car is more than a means of getting from A to B; it can mean freedom, status, excitement and also danger. Young drivers, and young male drivers in particular, are by far the least safe road users. PC Nick Finning is dispatched in search of a 'pool car' that's being driven at breakneck speed around residential streets. PC Finning explains that a pool car is 'a car that's been purchased normally for £200 or less... it won't be registered to anyone... it's untraceable and that vehicle is shared.' Some of Wiltshire's young men aren't even waiting to get their licences before taking to the roads. Joyriding, which had almost disappeared, has suddenly resurged in the county, and along with it come the crimes of car-key burglary and bilking(n)

programme.title: Hidden Britain by Drone
programme.desc: (recently seen on Channel 4). Britain is full of places that are hidden from public view, with their secrets locked away behind high walls and heavy gates... until now. History and travel enthusiast Sir Tony Robinson uses the latest aerial filming technology to reveal new aspects of our country in a completely different way. Dispatching flying cameras of many shapes and sizes, Tony opens up the far reaches of Britain. In this episode, Tony sends his drones to a top-security active nuclear decommissioning site. They also reveal the truth behind crop circles and explore the hidden world of bats(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts another edition of the panel game, with Sean Lock and Liza Tarbuck taking on guest captain Sarah Millican with Romesh Ranganathan. Susie Dent is joined by Phill Jupitus in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for this edition is La Riviera, a fine-dining restaurant in Inverness. Owned by multi-millionaire Barry Larson and costing £8000 a week to run, the place boasts top French chef Loic Lefebvre and an impeccably-trained kitchen staff with Michelin star-studded backgrounds. Loic is on a mission to bring sophisticated French cooking to the home of haggis, tatties and deep-fried Mars bars. But the locals aren't biting and the restaurant's empty most nights. There's a sharp smell of déjà vu in the air for Gordon, whose own venture in Scotland - Amaryllis - had to close. Can Ramsay save La Riviera from the same fate(n)

programme.title: Elsa the Lioness
programme.desc: An interview with David Attenborough and Joy Adamson on location in Kenya with Elsa the lioness, filmed just prior to the big cat's death in 1960(n)

programme.title: BBC Proms 2018
programme.desc: John Wilson conducts the London Symphony Orchestra in a concert performance of Leonard Bernstein's On the Town, the hit Broadway musical following the adventures of three sailors on shore leave in 1944. Katie Derham presents live from the Royal Albert Hall, with guest Clarke Peters(n)

programme.title: West Side Stories - The Making of a Classic
programme.desc: West Side Story is one of the best-loved musicals of all time, with its timeless story and exhilarating dance and music continuing to excite audiences around the globe. Songs such as Maria, Somewhere, Tonight and America having become some of the biggest hits in showbusiness and yet the musical had an uneasy birth and was even turned away by producers when it was first put together in the 1950s. In this documentary, Strictly Come Dancing judge Bruno Tonioli and Radio 3 presenter Suzy Klein examine the origins of West Side Story, which brought together the talents of Arthur Laurents, Leonard Bernstein, Stephen Sondheim and Jerome Robbins(n)

programme.title: Leonard Bernstein at the BBC
programme.desc: Composer, conductor, author, lecturer and pianist Leonard Bernstein was an icon of 20th-century music, a fact immediately recognised at the time of his death in 1990. This programme features 50 years of his archive performances and interviews at the BBC, some unseen since their original broadcast. Clips include West Side Story, Elgar's Enigma and works by Beethoven(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1986
programme.desc: Gary Davies and Dixie Peach present the programme from 6 March 1986, featuring Mike and the Mechanics, Kate Bush, Tavares, Whistle, Diana Ross and Huey Lewis and the News(n)

programme.title: Heavy Metal Britannia
programme.desc: Documentary tracing the genre's emergence in the late 1960s, pioneered by bands including Black Sabbath and Judas Priest, who were based in the industrialised Midlands. This classic form of metal was challenged by punk in the late 1970s, before a new wave of groups such as Iron Maiden, Def Leppard and Saxon reinvigorated the style. Featuring contributions by singers Ian Gillan, Glenn Tipton, Lemmy, Bruce Dickinson and Rob Halford, guitarist Tony Iommi and keyboard player Jon Lord. Narrated by Nigel Planer(n)

programme.title: Simon Rattle: The Making of a Maestro
programme.desc: Documentary following the principal conductor of the Berlin Philharmonic over the course of a year as he prepares for a series of concerts, oratorios and operas with five different orchestras.
